{{cpp/title|iostream_category}}
{{cpp/io/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=ios|since=c++11|
const std::error_category&amp; iostream_category() noexcept;
}}

Obtains a reference to the static error category object for iostream errors. The object is required to override the virtual function {{c|error_category::name()}} to return a pointer to the string {{c|"iostream"}}. It is used to identify error codes provided in the exceptions of type {{lc|std::ios_base::failure}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
A reference to the static object of unspecified runtime type, derived from {{lc|std::error_category}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;fstream&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
 
int main()
{
    std::ifstream f("doesn't exist");
    try
    {
        f.exceptions(f.failbit);
    }
    catch (const std::ios_base::failure&amp; e)
    {
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "Caught an ios_base::failure.\n"
                  &lt;&lt; "Error code: " &lt;&lt; e.code().value() 
                  &lt;&lt; " (" &lt;&lt; e.code().message() &lt;&lt; ")\n"
                  &lt;&lt; "Error category: " &lt;&lt; e.code().category().name() &lt;&lt; '\n';

    }
}
|p=true
|output=
Caught an ios_base::failure.
Error code: 1 (unspecified iostream_category error)
Error category: iostream
}}
